com:
Additional features
The Colosseums of Limgrave, Leyndell, and Caelid will open their gates, allowing players to engage in battles such as duels, free-for-alls and team fights.
Added new quest phases for the following NPCs: Sorceress Sellen / Thops / Corhyn
Added the function to send summoning signs to summoning pools in multiple areas, including distant areas.
Added a new way to advance Sorceress Sellen's questline other than proceeding the questline normally
When sending a co-op sign to distant areas with this function, summoning pools in “Mohgwyn Palace” will be excluded
Added some summonable NPCs in multiple situations.
Added function for co-op to never disband after area boss defeated
Added the function to invade a larger area, including distant areas
Added separate damage and leveling scaling for PvP in Colosseum
BALANCE ADJUSTMENTS
Increased Colossal Swords/Colossal weapons attack speed and lowered their recovery time. Jump attack not included.
Increased the two-handed attack damage of Colossal Swords/Colossal Weapons. Jump attack not included.
Increased physical block rate and guard boost
of the Colossal Sword, Colossal Weapons, Great Sword, Great Hammer, Great Axe, Great Spear, and Halberd weapon classes.
Increased the damage of Grafted Blade Greatsword.
Increased the damage of Devourer’s Scepter.
Decreased the scaling of status effect build-up from spells and incantations of Albinauric Staff and Dragon Communion Seal.
Players will need to perform any of the following actions for the changes to be reflected. This is required only once. New characters created after this update will not require this action.
Level up
Activate Godrick’s Great Rune
Re-equipping any equipment (armor, talisman) which grants bonus stat to either Strength, Dexterity, Vigor, Endurance, Intelligence, Faith or Arcane
Other enemy and weapon balance changes

last_replies.com:
The game was teetering into an even MORE casual (yea yea I know) AND less engaging moba to play after S3. After the removal of ELO clamp it became super easy to climb ranks. So during s1-3/4 you knew when you were q'ing for high elo (think D1 50LP+) before master and challengers bullshit you knew your matches were going to be decent quality. You would get your occasional troll or just some dude hard tilted whos gonna feed his brains out but they generally knew how to play the game. After the ELO clamp removal it was just fucking morons everywhere because you could spam fotm overtuned champs and climb due to the strength in builds as opposed to the quality of the player.

In terms of gameplay the addition of buff camps global timers is when I knew the game was pretty much over for me. It's definitely a QoL change but it makes it easier for bad (read as people with bad game sense/poor memory) to play the game. For the general masses they were excellent changes and they were the right choice to help league of legends grow even more. I enjoyed that extra layer (which wasn't necessary for lower level play) of game knowledge being dependent on the player not the systems.

It's by no means a bad game just like fortnite isn't a bad game but they aren't games for me. The latter being out of my scope and the former being pushed to the masses.

I dipped into dota 2 after quitting league and sit around 4300~ which is not great but it's a fun casual moba to play. I would love to see another enter the space but I just don't think any company is capable of entering that space and succeeding. Maybe a chinese company with an established cast of character.

tldr: growing games for general population = killing game for "hardcore" gamers

Compared to all previous Zelda games, yes they are hard. You eventually memorize their attack patterns and you eventually learn how to dodge, but the "eventually" takes longer for Lynels then it does for other Botw enemies or the whole Zelda series. People that do nothing but play 100s of games a year might adapt quicker, but to the majority of people playing Botw their will be a greater learning curve.

Things can be 'challenging' without being kaizo. SMB 1 is for all ages and can eventually be beaten by even an 8 year old. But that doesn't mean World 8 and the hammer bros aren't a difficult challenge to overcome in relation to the whole game.

last_replies.com:
The whole video games must be fun argument reminds me of the autist in high school that thought he was clever for making the argument that people only act in their self-interest or people only seek pleasure. You have to really reach on your definitions for the argument to hold and sometimes it's only in a "technically correct" way.

All I need from a videogame is for it to occupy me in an engaging way and elicit whatever particular mental state I find desirable. Whatever you need to call that experience fun or not really doesn't matter to me. In my opinion the videogames must be fun argument has more to do with the business of marketing and producing games than the artform aspect. Call of Duty better be "fun" because you did market research and that's what your audience wants and expects from call of duty.

last_replies.com:
>>620288136
honestly just play it for yourself, and I dont mean that in the shitty "i dont wanna tell you" kind of way. corruption is the most interesting to talk about because its the most controversial. I think it accomplishes things that are worth the trade offs, but you might not, idk
emulate it on primehack with mouse and keyboard. its more fun and it auto pilots the stupid fucking baby puzzle zelda shit

prime 3 is about as linear as prime 1 and 2, but the map is organized into even more and tighter sections than prime 2's four major areas. sometimes progression feels small in scope like getting a ship upgrade.
you hardly use your ship in this game but its involved in progression walls even if it doesnt add to your moment to moment tool kit
the hand scanner stuff and lever pulling and arm slot twisting motion gimmicks are just kind of there. alot of it just skips a bomb slot in my opinion, I feel indifferent to it. I never though bomb slots were so immersive anyway.
The big trade off is that hypermode is fun and feels satisfying IMO. you spend your hp to do a shitload of damage, but its only straight up required sometimes. alot of the time, hypermode is for when you think a fight should be over by now. you can either barely spend hp and only lose like 40 or so, but you can sacrifice a whole energy tank and take damage on purpose to get as much cost effective ammo as possible
